text:
I really wanted to like this restaurant and write a good review because when I looked it up on yelp it had good reviews, than when I came in I liked how it was decorated inside ( it was also Halloween) and I loved the menu and the choices.... When I ate the mini-burgers I found them to be nothing special, the price that they are asking for them is ridiculous considering the taste/size of the burger and amount of meat/ place where the restaurant is... the sweet potato fries were good but they never gave me any sauce to go with them.
All of the above could have passed for at least 3 stars for me, but! the same night after eating there I became very very badly sick! It was the only thing I ate on that day so it's certain that I got sick from that. 
I am calmer now because the sickness almost passed, and it has been already 5 days, but if I could write that review on the day that I was sick it would be totally different and with a lot of bad words in it :) 
Anyways, that was my experience in that restaurant
Brilliant restaurant. Love the vibe and concept. Basically, fancy poutines, mini burgers and tartars, paired with interesting drinks served in Mason jars. Try the White Massongria !

Je connaissais déjà Taboo puisque je suis allée à celui de l'Assomption et j'avais bien aimé. Celui de Montréal étant tout près de mon travail, c'était logique d'y aller aussi.

Le resto est vraiment jolie et bien décoré. Le personnel est gentil et sympathique.

Le concept du Taboo est de servir de petites portions de burger, tartare et poutine. Avec les différentes combinaisons d'assaisonnement et de viande, on peut faire 180 sortes de tartares!
On peut donc essayer plusieurs mets et j'adore de concept! J'ai choisi le burger Mozza, le tartare au boeuf classique et le bison italien. Le mélange boeuf-classique était parfait, mais j'ai un peu moins aimé l'assaisonnement italien, quoique le bison était bon. Pour agrémenter le tout, nous avons pris les frites épicées. Succulentes!

Les drinks sont aussi un plus du resto. J'ai pris un sling shot et une sangria blanche. Les deux étaient parfaits!

Un bon resto qui est quand même récent, mais qui fera rapidement sa marque à Montréal :)
Nous avons été agréablement surpris par la qualité des plats, de l'ambiance et du service. Une très belle découverte dans le centre ville de Lassomption. Nous y retournerons surement bientot.

This little spot has a huge menu. You get to pick and choose several of many creative burgers. I've honestly never seen a menu with this many. They're all interesting and you'll want to try more than you can probably eat. They also serve poutines, salads, and ceviche.

I tried a sampler of 3 burgers and the mushroom poutine. The burgers were delightful, I highly recommend you get the sampler instead of buying burgers individually. The poutine was surprisingly well done too, the fries were done just the way I like them thick and chewy.

I'll be coming back to try more burgers.

Good place for the young crowd. After being there a minute we realized it was filled with 18-20 year olds. Staff was perfectly nice, the space was modern, clean and bright. They had a weird role about having to order some food to be able to buy drinks - something to do with the type of liquor license

J'avais vu sur les médias sociaux ce restaurant donc je me suis arrêté pour l'essayer,  nous avons pris l'assiette de tartare avec 3 tartares pré choisis dedans et on a choisi trois petits mini Burger.

J'avais deux mini Burger avec un poisson ou fruits de mer qui était vraiment excellent et un au bison que j'ai un peu moins aimé et pour les tatars je dois dire que c'était très frais. Ils m'ont dit qu'ils auraient une terrasse cet été donc j'ai très hâte de retourner pendant l'été.

Situated in downtown Montreal, this new hip place opened just recently, January 2018. 
They sit you at the table and the menu is right in front of you because it's literally the table cloth. 
And oh man it's quite a menu. I'm assuming their specialties are: mini burgers, poutines and tatares. 
Their tatares ranges from salmon to bison and anything in between (including kangourous! Yes you heard me right: kangourous from Australia!). You can then combine with 10 different spices and sauces. I tried their salmon with their kamikaze sauce and the kangourou with Jack's beef sauce (those were the recommended combinations by our lovely waiter). It was delicious! The taste and flavourness hit the right spot. No overwhelming taste of raw meat, everything is well mixed and the ingredients just works so well together. 
I also tried their far west miniburger; bison meat with a BBQ sauce. It was also very good. 
The prices are decent especially for something downtown. 
They also have a variety of drinks to go with your meal. Again, tons of choices of cocktail to choose from. Did I mention they serve them in a mason jar?
Overall, a great and refreshing culinary experience definitely going back there. Special mention to our waiter Chris. He was very helpful and friendly.

Fun fact: Thursday ladies night (drinks 50% off) and for us guys we need to go 5 à 7 for our discount!

Great burger and poutine place!  They also make really nice tartar!  We had kangaroo tartar and duck tartar (to share for the table).  Really nice selection of mini-burgers, so you can try multiple combos.  The donut-burger is delicious (could substitute for dessert!).  The poutine here is quite excellent, with a variety of choices (including foie!).  They have other appetizers and drinks to choose from as well.  The menu is likely a bit meat-heavy for non-meat-eaters (not me), but there are lots of seafood options.  The space has a fun, modern bar-feel to it.  Service was good.  Apparently they have only been open in this location about 4 months; but definitely would recommend this spot.

Service vraiment bon! bouffe bonne et pas trop chère car les mini-burger ne sont pas si mini et le tartare et les poutines sont bourrantes aussi. 

Ambiance vrm jeune et lfun!

De 4@7 du lundi au jeudi tous les drinks sont 50%off et les jeudis c des ladies nights fec les salades sont aussi 50% off pour elles!

Awesome restaurant with seemingly endless options of miniburgers and tartar. Keeping with the restaurants rebellious theme, and as the wild man I am, I tried the kangaroo and bison tartars along with a foie gras minibuger on a homemade donut with maple demi glaze. My dad had a couple of different seafood burgers and lobster poutine. Everything was soo delicious, the plates were basically licked clean! All food is freshly prepared upon order so plan to stay a while and enjoy the experience. Cocktail menu is extensive and all drinks were excellent. Only a few of options for wine by the glass, so be ready to pop some bottles.

Nous sommes allés à Taboo le jeudi après la saint-valentin pour un repas en amoureux après que j'ai entendu parler de cette place via Yelp. J'ai été particulièrement attirée par les rabais du jeudi pour les femmes!! 

Nous avons trouvé la place facilement et nous avons très vite remarqué que c'était un restaurant très "trendy". Il y a un DJ, la musique est plutôt forte et la lumière est très faible. Ce n'est pas mon genre de restaurant mais j'étais très attiré par le menu.  Niveau décors, tout match avec l'idée d'un restaurant populaire, un peu hipster, le mur en béton brisé-ish, etc... le seul truc qui ne fonctionnait pas c'était les trois télévisions au dessus du bar, ça fait plus pub à mon goût, mis on pouvait suivre les JO donc c'était cool.

Pour le menu, j'adore!!! C'est un menu centré poutine, burger et tartare, et il y a quelques salades. Nous avons pris une poutine chacun, la zombie et la végétarienne. La zombie était très bonne, mais il y avait tellement de topping qu'on  ne goûtait pas tout, et la végétarienne à base de patate douce était tout aussi délicieuse mais manquait un peu de croustillant à mon goût. Nous avons également pris une salade au poulet et noix, qui était à -50% pour les femmes. La salade était au top, le poulet était super bien assaisonné, le bol était rempli, il y avait des noisettes, pistaches et plein d'autres aliments extra bons et qui te remplissent la panse, mais j'ai surtout aimé leur vinaigrette aux agrumes.

Je pense que j'y retournerai pour essayer leur burger mais je pense pas que j'y retournerai un autre jour que le jeudi, avoir -50% sur les boissons c'est toujours un plus.

Great restaurant for a solid night out! You definitely want to call ahead for a reservation (Canadians love reservations) we got lucky and a table opened up. The food and service were excellent! I highly recommend going with a group so you can try a little of everything. The burgers are small and delicious, but go easy if you plan on ordering poutine and tartar as well. I ordered the Taboo and pirate burgers. The taboo was good but the pirate was out of this world with the filet mignon and lobster! We also ordered the KANGAROO and duck tartars! Great tartar!! They have specialty mixes and we tried the kangaroo jack beef and the duck truffle tartars and they were flavorful! For poutine we tried the Poêlé which had foie gras and truffle oil. It was good but then we had the zombie poutine and that was the best poutine I've had hands down. This place is new, great, and is definitely worthy of your night out!

Although mbrgr will always have a special place in my heart, good things must always come to an end. In this case, good things have come to an end and given way for something even better. 

I got a chance to check out Taboo during Poutine week and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the veggie poutine and my friend ordered the zombie poutine. First of all, you have to enjoy thick cut fries to be a fan of this one. The veggie poutine comes with vegetables complemented with goat cheese. My friends, this is a RICH poutine. This is not something that I'd eat every single but it's nice to indulge once in awhile. It was very good and I'd love to try the mushroom or regular one next time I come. They also serve sliders and burgers which I didn't get an oppurtunity to try but would be very open to coming again. 

Overall, the vibe of this place is very cool. The design and space is on point with some rustic and warm wooden touches giving the place some character. Plan your next cheat meal accordingly and get yourself to Taboo and grab some nice drinks and food with some friends!

I popped into this place for a quick lunch, and I feel a little bad giving it 3 stars rather than 4... but honestly, I just can't justify the price of this place. 

It serves three main dishes: poutine, mini burgers, and tartare. Weird combination of specialities, but sure!

I had two Buffalo Bill mini burgers and truffle parmesan fries, for the semi-reasonable lunch special price of $18. That's two MINI burgers and fries. For $18. 

The mini burgers (of which there are over 30 varieties) seem to be priced mostly between $6 to $16 for one burger, depending on how fancy the ingredients are, and at that point I guess I don't understand why they don't just have normal-sized burgers, because I certainly don't want to splash out on a range of burgs if it's going to cost WAY more to do it that way. 

The fries were great, because they were truffle fries. No complaints there. The bison-and-goat cheese burgers were good, and I tend to like smaller portions of things anyway so I was personally glad to not have to eat a whole bison burger, but still - so expensive. 

The poutine was also expensive, and while I didn't order it myself, I thought the 17 varieties of $15+ poutines were just far too fancy. I don't know about you, but I love the greasy original poutine for what it is. I don't know many people who are looking to spend nearly $20 for a poutine with feta and a red wine jus. At that point you might as well just eat good fancy food.

L'ambiance de ce resto-bar est quand meme bonne. MAIS, ne venez jamais ici pour manger. Le prix de la nourriture est absolument trop chère. Pour une salade césar c'est 15$, 18$ si tu veux avec du poulet grillé. Et elle n'est pas tant bonne non plus. Dans la salade le poulet était vraiment sec et les mini-burgers a 5$ la viande était trop cuite et sec aussi. Mais le coté bar est très bon. Donc en tout, la partie resto 2/5 et la partie bar 4/5.
